sub_title: FinTech & IT Consultancy | VP Partner Operations at Nuvei

education.degree_name: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

profile_positions.description:
The Global Boarding and Implementations Team has been restructured as part of the acquisition synergy strategies of Worldline's Digital Commerce entities.

The focus is to combine the operational teams involved in the onboarding process with a mission to increase the order to revenue cycle while providing excellent customer service. 

Responsible for driving daily operations across the boarding and implementations teams, managing the end-to-end project life cycle of our clients, and the end-to-end technical integration part respectively.

Steering strategical initiatives to optimize BAU activities, streamlining processes and establishing synergy operational roadmaps across digital commerce entities.
profile_positions.title: Head of Global Boarding and Implementations

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all the Implementation Management Teams globally. Teams are located in the Netherlands, Singapore, China, NorthAmerica, Argentina, and Brazil.

The Implementation Management team is responsible for managing the technical integrations of our clients from the onboarding stage, production go-live, and maintenance.

Also responsible for the Merchant Boarding Services team based in the Netherlands, which handles the tools creation, enhancement, maintenance, as well as user management, quality and compliance audits.
profile_positions.title: Head of Global Merchant Implementations

profile_positions.description:
The Technical Services (Merchant Implementations) Team, as part of the Customer Experience Center in Operations, manages the technical integration of eCommerce merchants into the company's processing platform.

I also manage the Quality Services team that deals with tools update, audit-related matters and global liaison.
profile_positions.title: Manager Technical Services EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Ingenico epayment is the global leader in seamless payment, providing smart, trusted and secure solutions to empower commerce across all channels. It is the global reference in payment solutions dedicated to online and mobile commerce.

Consisting of the Client Project Management and Vendor Applications Management teams, Boarding Management EMEA is at the border of Sales and operations (involved in Pre Sales activities). The teams are responsible for a smooth continuation/delivery on effectuated commercial agreements by working directly with clients, payment suppliers and internal stakeholders which is known to be a tedious process altogether. 

One of the main missions of the role apart from overseeing boarding operations is to build and implement strategies to reduce time to revenue for Ingenico’s ready to board clients. I strive on attaining optimal boarding experience for the clients and for involved internal stakeholders and enhance its visibility across sub process and platforms. I have a strong customer-focused mindset and is very passionate in my work, driving for efficiency and productive changes.

Key Competencies:
- Operational, relationship and supplier management
- Effective communication skills and record for coordination between globally located teams
- Technical integrations and implementations
- Excellent domain experience in global solutions, online payments, KYC/AML Compliance and Regulatory Compliance
- Solid understanding of global payment industry and eCommerce payment gateway implementations
- Proven track record on project management technical/functional support, change management, process improvement, functional testing for end-to-end delivery projects
profile_positions.title: Director of Boarding Management EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for the end-to-end coordination and technical implementation of the offerings sold to the clients (online merchants). This entails the integration with the Global Collect payment platform & infrastructure and configuring the on- and offline systems according to merchant needs within the agreed service levels. Also responsible for processing changes for existing merchants.

The role involves intensive remote merchant interaction (approx. 80% of the role) and requires solid project management skills. Involved in the definition of the scope of services and responsible for setting realistic timelines, safeguarding the progress of the implementation and the follow-up of procedures. The execution also requires constant coordination with internal sales & support roles and manage various projects simultaneously.
profile_positions.title: Implementation Manager

profile_positions.description:
•	Part of the core banking team focusing on development of modules catering CEEMEA countries related to fund transfers. Involved in intensive unit testing of project deliverables ensuring quality of product and services. 
•	Point of Contact for Poland Team serving as the counterpart for clients based in Singapore.
•	Enhance and modify existing online and batch modules related to fund transfer applications.
•	Attend client conference calls dealing with all related activities of the conversion from data mapping, conversion scope analysis, conversion specifications analysis, fund transfer process gaps design analysis and development.
•	Worked on IMPACS conversion which involves creating and modifying complex modules to convert into the standardized applications. (COBOL, JCL, VSAM, Changeman)
•	Built online interfaces on a SOA (Service Oriented Architecture) Messaging Interface to communicate to several front-end applications.
profile_positions.title: Senior Lead Developer

profile_positions.description:
Involved in a project to improve operational capability and quality and to support on going rationalization of products. One of the main features of this implementation is the development of a standard build in RLS. Standard build means that across 11 countries, all tables are standardized and all products are unique. The migration will also act as a filter for products not meeting the bank’s criteria (like not used or little used or non revenue generating, etc.).
Part of the requirements include:
•Creating new medium to complex modules converting master files.
•Acting as primary support on SIT to production implementation.
•Creating technical and program specifications for requirements being handed-off.
profile_positions.title: Analyst Programmer

profile_positions.description:
Client: US Credit Card Company

Worked with a team as a senior designer for conversion team, outsourced for an international credit card company. Team geared towards converting DB2 applications into a CICS platform. 
Requirement Highlights:
•Analyzed and designed medium to complex requirements, monitoring its implementation from development, unit tests up to user acceptance test.
•Maneuvering CICS platform was required to test and analyze requirement details.
•Taken coding responsibilities and design reviews for other development documents when capacity lacks. 
•Received corporate recognition for developing automation tools to ease the design documentations.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Client: US Utilities Service Provider

Project: CERT Environment Set-Uo
Lead the project for the mainframe environment set-up, working with a team of eleven staff with a mix of junior and senior programmers. The work resulted in automated processing and increased user productivity in the financial applications, as well as the more manageable environment resource and module versions. Received corporate recognition and additional opportunities to lead key projects for my performance on the said project.
Requirement Highlights:
•Project Leader of the CERT Environment Set-Up Project; each phase having finished ahead of schedule and within budget which received recognitions from clients and upper management
•Underwent trainings for Control-M usage and has been appointed the ControlM POC offshore
•Responsibilities included the coordination, monitoring, and status reporting of all incoming environment set-up projects and allocation of available resources; supervision of the team for standardization practices; as well as random selection of project backlog, prioritized by need, scope of project and effectiveness.
•Generated metrics for status reporting purposes presented to the clients.

Project: Meter and Measurement
Reporting directly to the Project Manager and to on-shore counterparts, I spearheaded the entire development of two key projects for our clients, in conjunction with scheduled meetings for project coordination, requirements gathering, and down to the design and code implementation of the system.
Requirement Highlights: 
•Fully involved in coordinating with the clients in building the system and database design up to full life cycle development of Meter Enhancement, a new-fangled meter monitoring innovation for the electric consumers, providing sub-file intensive, end user controls and overrides.
•Been the project owner, coordinating the progress and over-all status of the development process. Created the driver module for the system.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Client: US Telecommunications Company
Worked as part of the billing group, I spearheaded and developed modules to convert the information section of the telephone bills format from its old form to vision format. I owned the task of gathering the requirements for the conversion, analyzing the detailed designs, coding the modules, conduct several tests and oversee the conversion project.
Requirement Highlights: 
•Though being the youngest and newest member of the team, I quickly gained the ownership of the whole information section in a month’s time, which will then be integrated with the rest of the bill sections.
•Revised impacted COBOL modules and created new ones to meet the conversion requirements.
•Constructed unit, system and regression test plans, conducted them efficiently within metrics.
•Project gained recognitions from the clients and counterparts which resulted to more work assigned
•Received multiple High Performance awards for the project’s quality deliverables and good variance
•Received Innovation awards for the bill-message generator tool that speed up the work process by 75 percent and had lessen the defects identified by 50 percent.
profile_positions.title: Senior Software Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Client: US Telecommunications Company
Project: Asset Management System
Hired as a Jr programmer and under mentorship of the project manager, I quickly progressed to being a key contributor to the Asset Management team. I contributed to the full life cycle application development, enhancements and technical support and various operations functions for the Asset Management System. Additional responsibilities included production support, maintenance of the system, report generations and system enhancements.
Project Highlights:
•Co-developed the asset tracking system with report generations provided to the clients.
•Created training documentations for the end-users and had the, converted to online trainings using Flash
•Designed the online screen interface and tested command functionalities
•Received commendations from end-users and clients on the smooth transition of the project and user-friendly online trainings
profile_positions.title: Software Engineer
